CatDescriptText: Mrs. John Davis, 721 Wilkinsburg Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "Not knowing too much about the subject, I can't say too much. One never knows what the real reason is.  I don't think that it would be fair to say that it is because of prejudice, because some of our people are in on the raiding parties."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. John Davis wearing dark hat with netting and feather, eyeglasses, and light colored blouse with brooch, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Downtown
